definition: east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
the Indian subcontinent (esp. in Tang or Buddhist context)
lower bound (math.)/world of mortals/(of Gods) to descend to the world of mortals
Lingshan county in Qinzhou 欽州|钦州[Qin1 zhou1], Guangxi
to greet and usher in (guests, newcomers etc)/(Buddhism) to receive into the Pure Land
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
monk (Sanskrit: Sramana, originally refers to north India)/Buddhist monk
Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4
